title: How to Make Apple Baklava

steps.headline: Cut the apple into quarters.
steps.description: Remove the core and peel and grate each piece.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the grated apple with lemon juice.
Chop the pistachios into large pieces.
steps.description: Keep aside one tablespoon for the end of the recipe. Mix the remaining chopped pistachios with the powdered almonds, apple, cinnamon and icing sugar.

steps.headline: Melt the butter over low heat or in the microwave on medium power.
steps.description: Let it cool down again. Preheat the oven to 150 °C (302 °F).

steps.headline: Grease a baking tray.
steps.description: Lay down 2 filo sheets. Brush the sheets with melted butter.

steps.headline: Lay another 2 filo sheets over these two sheets and cover in melted butter.
Layer the pistachio mixture across this filo layer.
Lay down the next 2 filo sheets and coat in melted butter.
steps.description: Continue with layering and brushing over the melted butter until all sheets are added.

steps.headline: Brush the melted butter over the top layer.
Cut 6 equal pieces to the depth of 1.5 centimeter (0.6 in) prior to placing the baklava in the oven.
Remove from the oven and allow to cool.
steps.description: Once cooled, cut through each piece completely to separate the baklava sections.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: Sprinkle icing sugar and caster sugar over the top of each piece. Finish off with a touch of chopped pistachios for each piece. If wished, add a dollop of cream to each piece of baklava for serving and a sprig of mint.

text: Cut the apple into quarters. Remove the core and peel and grate each piece. Sprinkle the grated apple with lemon juice.  Chop the pistachios into large pieces. Keep aside one tablespoon for the end of the recipe. Mix the remaining chopped pistachios with the powdered almonds, apple, cinnamon and icing sugar. Melt the butter over low heat or in the microwave on medium power. Let it cool down again. Preheat the oven to 150 °C (302 °F). Grease a baking tray. Lay down 2 filo sheets. Brush the sheets with melted butter. Lay another 2 filo sheets over these two sheets and cover in melted butter.  Layer the pistachio mixture across this filo layer.  Lay down the next 2 filo sheets and coat in melted butter. Continue with layering and brushing over the melted butter until all sheets are added. Brush the melted butter over the top layer.  Cut 6 equal pieces to the depth of 1.5 centimeter (0.6 in) prior to placing the baklava in the oven.  Bake for 30 minutes.  Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Once cooled, cut through each piece completely to separate the baklava sections. Serve. Sprinkle icing sugar and caster sugar over the top of each piece. Finish off with a touch of chopped pistachios for each piece. If wished, add a dollop of cream to each piece of baklava for serving and a sprig of mint.
